storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view visual indicators of scheduling conflicts on my calendar to quickly identify issues

testCases.title: Verify visual conflict indicators on calendar
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler
Calendar view is accessible
Scheduling system is operational
At least two resources are available for booking

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view loads successfully displaying current bookings

steps.action: Create a booking for Resource A from 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM on a specific date
steps.expectedResult: Booking is created and displayed on the calendar without any conflict indicator

steps.action: Create a second booking for Resource A from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM on the same date (overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict indicator (icon or highlight) appears on both conflicting calendar entries

steps.action: Click on the conflict indicator on the first booking
steps.expectedResult: Detailed conflict information is displayed showing the overlapping booking details, time conflict, and affected resource

steps.action: Close the conflict details popup or panel
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details close and calendar view remains visible with conflict indicators still present

steps.action: Modify the second booking to change the time from 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM (no overlap)
steps.expectedResult: Booking is updated successfully

steps.action: Observe the calendar entries for both bookings
steps.expectedResult: Conflict indicators are removed from both calendar entries as the conflict is resolved

postconditions: No conflict indicators are displayed on the calendar
Both bookings exist without time overlap
Calendar displays accurate booking information

testCases.title: Test real-time update of conflict indicators
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler
Calendar view is open and active
Scheduling system is operational
At least one existing booking is present on the calendar
System clock is synchronized for accurate timing measurement

steps.action: Note the current time and observe an existing booking on the calendar (e.g., Resource B from 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Existing booking is visible without conflict indicator

steps.action: Create a new booking for Resource B from 3:00 PM to 5:00 PM (creating an overlap)
steps.expectedResult: New booking is created

steps.action: Measure the time from booking creation to conflict indicator appearance
steps.expectedResult: Conflict indicator appears on both conflicting bookings within 1 second of creating the conflicting booking

steps.action: Verify that both bookings now display conflict indicators
steps.expectedResult: Both the original booking (2:00 PM - 4:00 PM) and new booking (3:00 PM - 5:00 PM) show conflict indicators

steps.action: Note the current time and modify the new booking to change the time from 4:00 PM to 6:00 PM (removing overlap)
steps.expectedResult: Booking is updated successfully

steps.action: Measure the time from booking modification to conflict indicator removal
steps.expectedResult: Conflict indicators disappear from both bookings within 1 second of resolving the conflict

steps.action: Verify that no conflict indicators remain on either booking
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays both bookings without any conflict indicators

postconditions: No conflicts exist between bookings
Real-time update performance meets the 1-second requirement
Calendar accurately reflects current booking status

testCases.title: Check conflict indicators on mobile interface
preconditions: User has valid Scheduler credentials
Mobile device (smartphone or tablet) is available
Mobile browser or application is installed and updated
Network connectivity is stable
Scheduling system is accessible via mobile interface

steps.action: Open the scheduling application on a mobile device and log in as Scheduler
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful and mobile interface loads properly

steps.action: Navigate to the calendar view on the mobile interface
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view is displayed in mobile-optimized format

steps.action: Create a booking for Resource C from 9:00 AM to 11:00 AM on a specific date
steps.expectedResult: Booking is created and visible on the mobile calendar

steps.action: Create a conflicting booking for Resource C from 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM on the same date
steps.expectedResult: Conflict indicators appear on both bookings and are clearly visible on the mobile screen

steps.action: Tap on the conflict indicator on the first booking
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details panel or popup opens displaying detailed conflict information in mobile-friendly format

steps.action: Review the conflict details including overlapping times, affected resource, and booking information
steps.expectedResult: All conflict information is readable and properly formatted for mobile display

steps.action: Close the conflict details and tap on the conflict indicator on the second booking
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details for the second booking are displayed with the same level of detail and accessibility

steps.action: Verify touch responsiveness and visual clarity of conflict indicators
steps.expectedResult: Conflict indicators are easily tappable, visually distinct, and do not overlap with other UI elements

postconditions: Mobile calendar displays conflict indicators correctly
Conflict details are accessible on mobile interface
User remains logged in on mobile device

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to generate reports summarizing scheduling conflicts to analyze patterns and improve scheduling practices

testCases.title: Generate conflict summary report with valid parameters
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler with report access permissions
Conflict data exists in the system for the selected date range
Reporting module is accessible and operational
Database contains at least 5 conflict records for testing

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting section from the main menu or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Reporting section loads successfully and displays available report types

steps.action: Select 'Conflict Reports' or 'Scheduling Conflicts' option
steps.expectedResult: Conflict report UI is displayed with parameter input fields including date range, filters, and sorting options

steps.action: Enter a valid start date (e.g., first day of current month) in the 'From Date' field
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and displayed in the correct format

steps.action: Enter a valid end date (e.g., last day of current month) in the 'To Date' field
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and displayed in the correct format

steps.action: Select filter options such as conflict type or affected resources if available
steps.expectedResult: Filter selections are accepted and displayed

steps.action: Note the current time and click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: System begins processing the report request and displays a loading indicator

steps.action: Measure the time from clicking 'Generate Report' to report display
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated and displayed within 5 seconds

steps.action: Review the generated report for conflict summary data including frequency metrics
steps.expectedResult: Report displays accurate data including total conflicts, conflict types, affected resources, date/time information, and resolution status

steps.action: Verify that the report includes metrics on conflict frequency by day, week, or month
steps.expectedResult: Frequency metrics are displayed with appropriate charts or tables

steps.action: Verify that conflict types are categorized and counted in the report
steps.expectedResult: Report shows breakdown of conflicts by type with counts and percentages

postconditions: Report is successfully generated and displayed
Report data matches the selected parameters
System performance meets the 5-second SLA
User remains on the report view page

testCases.title: Export report in PDF and Excel formats
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler with report export permissions
A conflict report has been successfully generated and is displayed on screen
Browser allows file downloads
Sufficient disk space is available for downloads

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict reports section and generate a report with valid parameters (date range: last 30 days)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict report is generated and displayed successfully with conflict data

steps.action: Verify that the report contains data including conflict summaries, metrics, and details
steps.expectedResult: Report displays complete information with tables, charts, and summary statistics

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export' or 'Download' button/dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu is displayed showing available formats (PDF and Excel)

steps.action: Select 'Export as PDF' option from the menu
steps.expectedResult: System initiates PDF generation and download process

steps.action: Wait for the PDF file to download and verify the download completion
steps.expectedResult: PDF file downloads successfully to the default download location with a meaningful filename (e.g., 'Conflict_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.pdf')

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and displays the complete report with all data, formatting, charts, and tables intact

steps.action: Return to the report view in the application and click the 'Export' button again
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu is displayed again

steps.action: Select 'Export as Excel' or 'Export as XLSX' option from the menu
steps.expectedResult: System initiates Excel file generation and download process

steps.action: Wait for the Excel file to download and verify the download completion
steps.expectedResult: Excel file downloads successfully to the default download location with a meaningful filename (e.g., 'Conflict_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.xlsx')

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file using spreadsheet software (Excel, Google Sheets, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully and displays the complete report data in spreadsheet format with proper columns, rows, and data formatting

steps.action: Verify that the Excel file contains all report data including metrics, conflict details, and summary information
steps.expectedResult: All data from the report is present and properly structured in the Excel file with headers and formatted cells

postconditions: Both PDF and Excel files are successfully downloaded
Downloaded files contain accurate and complete report data
Files are accessible and properly formatted
User remains logged in and on the report page

testCases.title: Handle invalid report parameters gracefully
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler
Conflict reports section is accessible
Reporting UI is displayed with parameter input fields

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict reports section
steps.expectedResult: Report UI is displayed with empty or default parameter fields

steps.action: Enter an end date that is earlier than the start date (e.g., Start: 2024-01-31, End: 2024-01-01)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the invalid date range

steps.action: Attempt to generate the report by clicking 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed indicating 'End date must be after start date' or similar message, and report generation is blocked

steps.action: Verify that the error message is clearly visible and user-friendly
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed in red or highlighted format near the date fields with clear instructions

steps.action: Clear the date fields and enter a future date range (e.g., dates beyond current date)
steps.expectedResult: Dates are entered in the fields

steps.action: Attempt to generate the report
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating 'Cannot generate reports for future dates' or the report generates with no data and appropriate message

steps.action: Clear the date fields and leave the start date empty while entering only an end date
steps.expectedResult: End date is entered, start date remains empty

steps.action: Attempt to generate the report
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating 'Start date is required' and report generation is blocked

steps.action: Enter a valid start date but leave the end date empty
steps.expectedResult: Start date is entered, end date remains empty

steps.action: Attempt to generate the report
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating 'End date is required' and report generation is blocked

steps.action: Enter an excessively large date range (e.g., 10 years) if system has range limits
steps.expectedResult: Dates are entered in the fields

steps.action: Attempt to generate the report
steps.expectedResult: Validation error or warning is displayed if date range exceeds system limits, or report generates with performance warning

steps.action: Correct all validation errors by entering a valid date range (e.g., last 30 days)
steps.expectedResult: Valid dates are accepted and no validation errors are displayed

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated successfully within 5 seconds with accurate conflict data for the specified valid date range

postconditions: System properly validates all report parameters
Invalid inputs are rejected with clear error messages
Report generation only proceeds with valid parameters
User can successfully generate report after correcting errors
